Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk augeas
exit 0

islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk augeas-debuginfo
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: augeas bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Augeas is a utility for editing configuration. Augeas parses configuration files in their native formats and transforms them into a tree. Configuration changes are made by manipulating this tree and saving it back into native configuration files. Augeas also uses "lenses" as basic building blocks for establishing the mapping from files into the Augeas tree and back. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the Grub lens did not support the "setkey" and "lock" directives, which caused the virt-v2v process to terminate unexpectedly when the grub.conf file contained these directives. With this update, the Grub lens supports "setkey" and "lock", and virt-v2v no longer fails in the described scenario. (BZ#1059581) When automounter maps contained references to hosts with host names containing hyphens, the automounter lens failed to parse these automounter maps. A patch has been provided to fix this bug, and the automounter maps are now parsed as expected. (BZ#1075162) Prior to this update, the Augeas utility did not properly handle colon characters (":") in the /etc/services file. As a consequence, "service_name" fields in /etc/services that contained a colon prevented Augeas from parsing the file. Augeas now handles colons as intended, which prevents the described problem. (BZ#1121527) Augeas was previously unable to parse the /etc/rsyslog.conf file if it contained IPv6 loghosts or was configured for remote logging over Transmission Control Protocol (TCP). This update fixes the problem and files containing this configuration are now parsed. (BZ#1129386, BZ#1129388) Prior to this update, when entries in the /etc/exports file contained IPv6 client addresses, Augeas was unable to parse the file. This has been corrected, and Augeas can now parse these entries as expected. (BZ#1067030) Previously, Augeas did not recognize certain types of cgroup controllers used in the /etc/cgconfig.conf file. As a consequence, the file was not parsed. With this update, Augeas can now parse files containing these controller names, as well as the /etc/cgconfig.conf file. (BZ#1112543) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: Lenses to parse the /etc/chrony.conf configuration file and the /etc/shadow password file have been added to Augeas. (BZ#1071947, BZ#1145249) Users of augeas are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
